author: COMSOL
description: This tutorial demonstrates the use of a Cross Grating feature in an Ã©chelle spectrograph. A cross grating is a periodic surface with two directions of periodicity. In this model the cross grating is used in high order in one direction and in first order in the orthogonal ("cross") direction. By this means, a two-dimensional cross-dispersed spectrum can be produced with a single grating. A parametric sweep across several orders is made, and the resulting ray and spot diagrams are generated.
label: cross_grating_echelle_spectrograph.mph
name: root

settings.name: labelinfile
settings.value: Contact doublet, specify clear aperture diameter

settings.name: commentsinfile
settings.value:
Spherical Doublet Lens 3D

Doublet lens formed using two instances of the 'Spherical Lens 3D' part. The two lenses may be either air-spaced or in contact.

settings.name: commentsinfile
settings.value:
Spherical Lens 3D

Spherical lens with either concave or convex surfaces. The lens surface diameters can be smaller than the outer diameter. Clear apertures which are smaller than the lens surface diameters can be specified.

settings.name: commentsinfile
settings.value:
Circular Planar Annulus

Circular planar annulus with negligible thickness.

settings.name: commentsinfile
settings.value:
Rectangular Planar Annulus

Rectangular planar annulus with negligible thickness.
